message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.GR 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it discusses Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) which are widely used in computer vision tasks. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel approach to generalize CNNs to irregular domains, which is a common problem in computer vision. 

The paper also discusses the use of graph-based operators, which suggests that it may belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category as graph-based methods are commonly used in machine learning. 

The paper's focus on proposing a new approach to generalize CNNs suggests that it may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

The use of weight sharing and graph-based operators to generalize CNNs suggests that the paper may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper's use of graph-based operators suggests that it may also belong to the Graphics (cs.GR) sub-category as graph-based methods are commonly used in computer graphics.
